data.enText: having little or no rain; very dry

data.chText: 枯燥的；乏味的；毫无新意的
data.enText: with nothing new or interesting in it

simple_means.memory_skill: ar 干 + id 有…性质的 → 干旱的

ex.enText: The lesson was long and boring.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指某事物或某人因毫无趣味、吸引力而让人感到乏味的、无聊的。

d: 令人厌烦的；乏味的，无聊的

ex.chText: 没多久听众就对他枯燥无味的演说感到厌烦了。
ex.enText: The audience soon grew tired of his arid speech.

synonyms.bx: 指某事物毫无趣味的，也指缺乏令人心动的特征或品质的。

ex.chText: 他厌倦了那个政客的枯燥演讲。
ex.enText: He is tired of the politician's dreary speech.

synonyms.bx: 指事物了无趣味、使人感到厌烦或沮丧的。

ex.chText: 关于外交政策的乏味辩论
ex.enText: a dry debate on diplomatic policies

ex.chText: 一本满是数据的书读起来很枯燥乏味。
ex.enText: A book full of figures is rather dry.

synonyms.bx: 指书籍、讲话、话题等干巴巴的、生硬的、缺乏幽默的，有时含贬义。

ex.chText: 他认为那不会是一次乏味的聚会。
ex.enText: He doesn't believe that it will be a dull party.

synonyms.bx: 作此义解时，通常只能用来形容事物，指因缺乏新鲜感、吸引力而显得乏味、沉闷的。

ex.chText: 这是春天里最单调的声音之一。
ex.enText: It is one of the most monotonous sounds of the spring.

synonyms.bx: 指没有变化、重复单调的。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：乏味的，无聊的

example: a technically perfect but arid performance of the sonata
a prissy and emotionless creature...settles into a mold of desiccated snobbery"-C.J.Rol
miles of waterless country to cross

value.def: Arid land is so dry that very few plants can grow on it.

example.ex: ...new strains of crops that can withstand arid conditions.
example.tran: 能抵抗干旱条件的新品种作物

value.def: If you describe something such as a period of your life or an academic subject as arid, you mean that it has so little interest, excitement, or purpose that it makes you feel bored or unhappy.

example.ex: She had given him the only joy his arid life had ever known.
example.tran: 她为他枯燥无味的生活带来了从未有过的乐趣。

example.ex: ...the politically arid years of military dictatorship in the 1960s and '70s.
example.tran: 在20世纪60和70年代军事独裁期间政事荒芜的岁月

value.tran: 枯燥无味的；乏善可陈的

partsOfSpeech.dec: ar 犁地 + ability 可…性 → 可耕性
ar 犁地 + able 可…的，能…的；具有…性质的 → 可耕种的
ar 干 + efac 做 + tion 表名词 → 弄干
ar 干 + id 有…性质的 → 干旱的
